intro: Bellevalia dubia var. fallax, commonly known as the Alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
